instruction: Wash the basmati or Jeerakasala rice thoroughly and soak it in water for 30 minutes.
title: Soak the Rice

transcript_segments.text: Greetings to all! I'm Mehema Supramanya and welcome to Home Cooking Telugu. Every place has its own unique biryani recipe with distinct flavors. So today, I'm making Malabar-style Talassery Biryani.

instruction: Boil water in a large pot, add salt and whole spices (cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, bay leaf). Add soaked rice and cook until it is 90% done. Drain the rice and set it aside.
title: Cook the Rice

transcript_segments.text: First, let’s prepare the garam masala powder. In a pan, add 4 cardamoms, 2 pieces of cinnamon, 5 cloves, 2 star anise, ½ tsp pepper, 2 small nutmegs, and 2 pieces of mace.
Dry roast these spices on a low flame for about 2 minutes until aromatic. Then switch off the stove, let it cool, and grind them into a fine powder. Set this aside.

instruction: Heat oil and 2 tablespoons of ghee in a deep pan. Fry the thinly sliced onions on medium heat until golden brown and crispy.
title: Fry Onions

transcript_segments.text: Next, I’m frying onions. Heat some oil in a pan and once hot, add thinly sliced onions and fry them. I’ve taken about 2 large onions here.

instruction: Remove half of the fried onions and set them aside for garnishing later.
title: Separate Onions for Garnish

transcript_segments.text: Next, I’m frying onions. Heat some oil in a pan and once hot, add thinly sliced onions and fry them. I’ve taken about 2 large onions here.
These are called fried onions. They add a lot of flavor to the biryani. As you can see, they’ve turned brown. Once golden and crispy, take them out and keep them aside.
In the same pan, add ½ cup of white raisins. Once they're fried, transfer them to a bowl and set aside for garnish.

instruction: In the remaining oil, add whole spices (if not already used in rice) and sauté briefly until aromatic.
title: Sauté Whole Spices

transcript_segments.text: In the same pan, add ½ cup of white raisins. Once they're fried, transfer them to a bowl and set aside for garnish.
Now for the chicken masala: take a wide pan and add ¼ cup ghee. Add 4 finely chopped onions and sauté. The more onions, the better the taste of the biryani.
[Unclear audio section, assumed continuation of sautéing and cooking onions, possibly mentioning stirring continuously and cooking until brown.]

instruction: Add ginger-garlic paste and slit green chilies. Sauté until the raw smell disappears.
title: Add Ginger-Garlic and Chilies

transcript_segments.text: After sautéing for 5 minutes, add ½ tsp turmeric, 2 tsp ginger garlic paste. Sauté this well. On high flame, add chicken pieces and cook until the raw smell goes away.
[Unclear audio; likely continuing chicken cooking steps and spice additions.]
After 10 minutes, I’m adding ½ cup thick curd. Stir it well so the curd doesn't split and gives a smooth texture. Continue cooking the chicken on high flame.

instruction: Add the remaining fried onions back into the pan and sauté for a few minutes until soft and well-mixed.
title: Cook Onions for Masala

transcript_segments.text: Add 2-3 handfuls of the fried onions to enhance the flavor. Finally, add fresh coconut milk and give it a good mix.

instruction: Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and oil starts separating from the masala.
title: Add Tomatoes and Spices

transcript_segments.text: With that, the chicken masala for the biryani is ready.
Now for the rice: I’m using 2 cups of Jeera Samba rice (short-grain aromatic rice). Wash and soak the rice before cooking.
Add cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, bay leaf, and star anise. I’ve added about 3–4 cups of water and 1 tsp of salt. Stir well and let it come to a boil.

instruction: Lower the heat and stir in the yogurt. Mix well to form a thick gravy base.
title: Add Yogurt

transcript_segments.text: Add cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, bay leaf, and star anise. I’ve added about 3–4 cups of water and 1 tsp of salt. Stir well and let it come to a boil.
Once the water boils, add the soaked rice. Mix everything well. Cook until the rice is 90% done. Drain the rice and set aside. Now the biryani rice is ready.

instruction: Add the chicken pieces. Mix to coat them well with the masala. Cover and cook until the chicken is tender and cooked through.
title: Cook Chicken

transcript_segments.text: To layer the biryani, take a large pot and first spread the cooked chicken masala at the bottom evenly. Arrange the cooked chicken pieces neatly.

instruction: Uncover and continue to cook until the gravy thickens and clings to the chicken.
title: Reduce Masala

transcript_segments.text: To layer the biryani, take a large pot and first spread the cooked chicken masala at the bottom evenly. Arrange the cooked chicken pieces neatly.

instruction: Grease the bottom of a heavy-bottomed pot with a little ghee. Spoon in half of the chicken masala as the first layer.
title: Prepare for Layering

transcript_segments.text: To layer the biryani, take a large pot and first spread the cooked chicken masala at the bottom evenly. Arrange the cooked chicken pieces neatly.

instruction: Add a layer of cooked rice over the chicken. Sprinkle fried onions, chopped mint, coriander leaves, lemon juice, and a drizzle of ghee.
title: Layer Rice and Garnishes

transcript_segments.text: On top of the chicken, drizzle 1 tsp ghee, add chopped coriander and mint leaves, some fried onions, raisins, and cashews. This gives extra flavor and richness.
Now add all the cooked rice on top and gently spread it. Add 1 tsp ghee, coriander, mint, fried onions, raisins, and cashews over the top.

instruction: Repeat layering with remaining chicken, rice, and garnishes. Ensure the final layer is rice topped with fried onions and herbs.
title: Repeat Layers

transcript_segments.text: Now add all the cooked rice on top and gently spread it. Add 1 tsp ghee, coriander, mint, fried onions, raisins, and cashews over the top.

instruction: Seal the lid tightly or use dough to secure the edges, preventing steam from escaping during cooking.
title: Seal the Pot

transcript_segments.text: Sprinkle some garam masala powder and saffron milk. Cover with aluminum foil tightly so no steam escapes.

instruction: Place the pot on low heat or on a preheated griddle (tava) and cook for 20-25 minutes. This slow steaming helps flavors meld beautifully.
title: Dum Cook the Biryani

transcript_segments.text: Place a lid on top. Heat a pan and place the biryani pot on top. Let it cook on medium flame. Now the biryani will cook on dum for 20 minutes.

instruction: In a small pan, heat remaining ghee and fry cashew nuts and raisins until golden.
title: Fry Cashews and Raisins

transcript_segments.text: Once done, gently scoop from the bottom to serve the chicken pieces and rice together. Garnish with fried onions, cashews, and coriander.

instruction: Open the biryani pot carefully. Sprinkle the fried cashews and raisins on top. Serve hot with raita, pickle, and pappadam.
title: Garnish and Serve

transcript_segments.text: Once done, gently scoop from the bottom to serve the chicken pieces and rice together. Garnish with fried onions, cashews, and coriander.
